title: What are the uses of the first 20 elements of the periodic table? - Quora

response.answer_text: For simplicity I’ll only describe one use of each element. Hydrogen is often used in power plants as a coolant for large generators that produce a lot of heat. 2. Helium is used in MRI machines to cool the magnetic devices within the machine.  3. Lithium is probably being used to power the phone or laptop you’re reading this answer on.  4. Beryllium is very light, flexible, and conductive, making it an ideal component for the exteriors of projectiles and high-speed aircraft.  5. Boron is often used to strengthen glass.  6. Carbon has countless applications, but one its allotropes, diamond, is used in drill bits to increase drilling ability.  7. Nitrogen is used in fertilizers in the form of nitrates and nitrites.  8. Oxygen we’re breathing it right now…  9. Fluorine is often added to toothpaste in its ionic form, fluoride.  10. Neon is often used to make dazzling signs because of its bright colors and incredible stability.  11. Sodium is a component of sodium chloride, which is table salt.  12. Magnesium is often used to strengthen the metal in vehicles such as cars and planes.  13. Aluminum:  14. Silicon is a crucial component in modern computer chips.  15. Phosphorus is used in matches.  16. Sulfur is used in some fungicides and pesticides.  17. Chlorine is an essential component of bleaches due to its high oxidative capabilities.  18. Argon is very inert, so it can be used to store highly reactive substances. The picture below shows cesium, a highly reactive alkali metal, being stored in argon as to avoid an explosive reaction in which cesium is oxidized.  19. Potassium is essential for human health, so it is often added to our food or taken as a supplement.  20. Because calcium reacts so readily with oxygen, it is often used in steelmaking to remove oxygen from the alloy.

Hydrogen - Rocket propellant, Chemical reagent, potential alternative fuel, coolant for electrical equipment, airship lifting gas.Helium - Lifting gas for balloons/airships, coolant for superconductors. Shielding gas for welding.Lithium - Batteries, psychiatric medications, constituent in light structural metals.Beryllium - Light, hard, strong structural metal, x-ray transparent materials.Boron - Composite materials, cleaning agents, semiconductors, chemical reagents.Carbon - Structural material, jewelry (diamonds), basis for all organic compounds, adsorbent material, pencils.Nitrogen - Primary component of the atmosphere, fertilizer production, rocket propellants, shielding gas for welding.Oxygen - Primary active component of atmosphere, medical use, steelmaking, support of combustion.Fluorine - Toothpaste, pharmaceuticals, etching of glass, rocket propellant (for use outside the atmosphere).Neon - Electric signs, lasers.Sodium - Table salt, glassmaking, baking soda, reducing agent.Magnesium - Structural material, dietary supplement, flashbulbs, fireworks.Aluminum - Structural material, ceramics (aluminum oxide).Silicon - Semiconductors, glassmaking, structural material.Phosphorus - Fertilizers, rust remover (phosphoric acid), matches.Sulfur - Primary starting material for sulfuric acid (which has MANY uses), detergents, odorant in natural gas, fungicide.Chlorine - Bleach, swimming pool disinfectant, chemical reagent, ingredient in salt.Argon - Shielding gas for welding, inert storage of substances that react with air.Potassium - Fertilizers, dietary supplements, reducing agent.Calcium - Dietary supplements, fertilizers, alloying element, batteries.Of course, this list is by no means all-inclusive.
